alert.note: Alert for Grady; Thomas (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 12 at 9:25AM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central Georgia and southwest Georgia, including the following counties, in south central Georgia, Thomas. In southwest Georgia, Grady. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 925 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen in the last 1 Hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Thomasville, Cairo, Ochlocknee, Coolidge, Dawesville, Pasco, Dillon, Merrillville, Chastain, Thomasville Municipal A/P, Quality, Pine Park, Newark, Grady Co A/p, Akridge, Patten, Spence, Eason, Capel and Enon. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
